availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles B. Coons (Mason County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Poyntz Coons in Mason County, Kentucky, on April 3, 1837. Father of William P. Coons, Charles G. Coons, Margarette Dye Coons, Emily Coons, Nancy Coons, Henry Coons, . Iron merchant in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Pork packer in Mason County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Mason County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 115B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 21A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 363.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 3B.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Mason County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 104.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film 000281842.
